meanings.definition: Contribute to a particular result or situation.
meanings.sent1: His hard work will redound to his success in the future.
meanings.sent2: Her positive attitude redounds to a happy work environment.
meanings.sent3: The team's effort to win the game redounded in a celebratory dinner.
meanings.sent4: The kindness you show others will redound back to you in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: Every good deed you do will redound positively in your life.

meanings.sent1: The sound of the bell redounded through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent2: Her laughter redounded off the walls of the small room.
meanings.sent3: The ball's bounce redounded comically high, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His words redounded in her mind, echoing with meaning.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight redounded off the mirror, creating a dazzling effect.
